Class JavaApiClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • JavaApiClient

  • public class JavaApiClient
extends java.lang.Object

    A Java API Client for Jira

    The JavaApiClient program (called Automate in the accompanying video) is a simple API client for the Atlassian Jira APIs. It performs five functions in the following order:

    1. Log into Jira
    2. Parse and save the JSESSIONID
    3. Call a Jira API to get data (using the JSESSIONID to authenticate)
    4. Convert the returned data from JSON into CSV format
    5. Save the CSV to a file

    Since:
    2019-05-16
    See Also:
    YouTube playlist showing development of this API client

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method. It creates the variables used through the calls to the five functions and calls them in the proper order. It also handles any errors and writes a final SUCCESS or FAILURE message.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused.

      • loginToJira

        public static java.lang.String loginToJira(java.lang.String baseURL,
                                           java.lang.String loginURL,
                                           java.lang.String loginUserName,
                                           java.lang.String loginPassWord)
        This method takes the user's credentials and uses them to make a request to log into a given Jira instance. It returns the response generated from that request.
        Parameters:
        baseURL - The protocol, server name, and port number on which Jira is running suffixed with "/jira/" or /jira/rest/" (e.g., http://company.loc:2990/jira/rest/)
        loginURL - The standard path to the login API for a Jira server which will be suffixed to the baseURL (e.g., auth/1/session)
        loginUserName - The username of a user who has permissions to view the issues which we would like to export out of Jira.
        loginPassWord - The password associated with the user named in loginUserName.
        Returns:
        loginResponse The response generated by Jira and returned when this method submits its login request.

      • parseJSessionID

        public static java.lang.String parseJSessionID(java.lang.String input)
        This method takes the response from a Jira login request and parses out the JSESSIONID which will be saved and used to authenticate future requests.
        Parameters:
        input - The response (in JSON format) from a Jira login request.
        Returns:
        jSessionID The value of the JSESSIONID assigned to this session by the Jira server.

      • getJsonData

        public static java.lang.String getJsonData(java.lang.String baseURL,
                                           java.lang.String biExportURL,
                                           java.lang.String jSessionID,
                                           java.lang.String analysisStartDate,
                                           java.lang.String analysisEndDate)
        This method calls a given Jira API (using a given JSESSIONID to authenticate the request), then returns the resulting response.
        Parameters:
        baseURL - The protocol, server name, and port number on which Jira is running suffixed with "/jira/" or /jira/rest/" (e.g., http://company.loc:2990/jira/rest/)
        biExportURL - The path to the IonaFX Business Intelligence Export add-in's REST API which will be suffixed to the baseURL (e.g., getbusinessintelligenceexport/1.0/message).
        jSessionID - The JSESSIONID returned as part of the response to the login request made in the loginToJira method.
        analysisStartDate - The first date of a period of time over which you wish to extract issues that were either added or updated.
        analysisEndDate - The last date of a period of time over which you wish to extract issues that were either added or updated.
        Returns:
        jsonData The response to this API call returned from the Jira server in JSON format.

      • formatAsCSV

        public static java.lang.String formatAsCSV(java.lang.String jsonData)
        This method takes the response from a Jira API request made to the IonaFX Business Intellience Export add-in's REST API and converts it from a JSON formatted string into CSV formatted string.
        Parameters:
        jsonData - The response (in JSON format) from the JIRA API request made to the IonaFX Business Intellience Export add-in's REST API.
        Returns:
        csvData The same data contained in the input data, but converted into CSV format.

      • writeToFile

        public static java.lang.String writeToFile(java.lang.String csvData,
                                           java.lang.String exportDirectory)
        This method takes a CSV-formatted string and writes it out as a file in a given directory.
        Parameters:
        csvData - A string in CSV format containing data which we wish to write into a file.
        exportDirectory - The path to a directory into which we wish to write our finished CSV-formatted file.
        Returns:
        writeToFileOutput An indicator of the success or failure of the operation.
